title: Does anyone actually think the Malz rework is better?
body:
Been on a LoL hiatus, used to main Malz mid and could comfortably win my lane no matter the hero. have come back and he's changed. Am I missing something or is he considerably weaker/boring?

His power seems to come from his voidlings, though anyone who knows that will focus them out so they aren't a threat, then his strength is mostly gone.

As far as I can remember it's not like he was played in the 'big leagues' so I wouldn't have thought this was a nerf move - but that's seemingly what's happened.

Old Malz could farm, lane pressure/push, melt any hero quite well. 

So unless I am missing some part of his gameplay, they have killed Malz and it's pretty disappointing lol. Another hero down the drain.

replies.body:
He was fine after his initial rework, then riot did a mini rework in 6.27 or something and 
changed his voidlings, which made him clunky to play, hence a lot weaker.

TLDR; initial rework great, mini rework shite

Ive been playing him mid/support

He seems pretty strong imo, cant play him ad jungle anymore tho.

I'm yet to have trouble against a competent Yasuo with him, provided I keep well away from Yas bouncing around the lane.

But if I want to drop voidlings and my E on Kat, well she'll just dive me and outdamage me and then some. In general he seems to be more vulnerable once dived(than old Malz was)

The only reason why you're frustrated is because you used to main Malz and you can no longer lane pressure/push, melt any hero as you put it.

Seems fine to me at the moment and has appeared quite a lot in the bot lane recently.

People who play Malz in general now can't really lane pressure/push & legitimately 1v1 any hero haha, I know I don't have a hard time playing against him now.

So yes, I'm frustrated that a champion that was strong but wasn't dominating the game/nor being picked as 'the' ap mid - gets reworked to something that'll be less played in future. No doubt once enough time has passed they'll realise he's a bit of a dead champ and will try to rework him back into the game then lol.

I think you'll generally find that it's "only" the people who care about/are attached to things that get frustrated by them when they change for the worse. So I'm glad it's an acceptable change for you to casually play him here and there, but it's different for those who play him as a main, but no longer.

> [{quoted}](name=MrSkibble,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=TKIGpG2w,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-01-24T10:46:36.220+0000)

> Old Malz could farm, lane pressure/push, melt any hero quite well. 

This was probably why they changed him?
No one likes a champion with no counterplay, and old Malz fitted better than most into that category. 
They wouldn't have just randomly updated a champ for no reason. 

New Malz is certainly more interesting, and arguably harder, which is a good thing. 

My beef with the new Malz though is that his voidlings intercept skillshots (and still live afterwards), so while Malz is getting damage off on you because his voidlings are swarming all around you, you cant get any off on him because his voidling's hitboxes soak up all the abilities you throw.

> [{quoted}](name=Lord Sesshomaru,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=TKIGpG2w,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2017-01-24T22:03:22.406+0000)

> My beef with the new Malz is that his voidlings intercept skillshots (and still live afterwards), so while Malz is getting damage off on you because his voidlings are swarming all around you, you cant get any off on him because his voidling's hitboxes soak up all the abilities you throw.


Well his ability to melt people from his old W was only strong late game with 4+ items (or If he got fed early). By that point people will have their own defensive items such as QSS or banshees to weaken his combo.

Malz needs his old ability lineup back as it was his strength/defence if he was dived by e.g. the overplayed Kat, Yasuo these days. But now once he's dived, he cannot deal enough damage to them to scare them off so they'll just go all in on him.

If he was such a problem hero, everyone would play him as they do Kat - but they don't, so I wouldn't think the reason for his change lies in how strong he was/wasn't.


Not having a go at you personally btw ^ :P Just frustrated by the change.

So Riot if you are reading this: Please change Malzahar back to the way he was. I can't imagine he's played more now because of this change, and probably less enjoyed by anyone who played Malz seriously.

Can't think of a reason to try and 'fix' what isn't broken. Some champions will always be played more than others - that doesn't mean that the ones less played are broken. If your reasoning was to recreate him into something 'new and fresh' well.. That's failed on both counts. He isn't fun as it's just about having your fingers crossed that the enemy will be dumb enough to ignore his Voidlings in a fight (or simply not have AoE damage). He's no different to Heim in that sense, and he's just as vulnerable without his turrets.


He's boring and a considerably weaker now.
- His passive is useful until he's poked once, basically no different to Malphite's passive.
- His old W and R have just been merged into one R at the same damage.
- He relies on his voidlings to do most of the damage in a fight - and they're just fragile things, so once they're killed like any other minion, Malz is vulnerable.

Malzahar was better before because he didn't rely on a single, wildcard ability as his defence and he was much more effective in picking up kills **on his own** the old way.

 
Could quite happily show you Riot, that the old Malz was better in every way - if you set up a match where I could fight this new Malz while playing as the old.

Would be interested to hear the reasoning behind the change and can debate why it didn't work out lol.

Ah good, it's not just me then.

Yea justice a lot of his items I still build the same, RoA, Lia, Rylais etc. But he just isn't as much of a threat now. If I'm waiting in a bush to gank whomever, there's a good chance they'll survive after I've spammed all my abilities on them so the voidlings do their damage - where as old Malz I could easily kill people in a few seconds.

I've found that he's more of a, slowly poke the enemy down on health til they have like 20% left, then make a play to kill them. In teamfights he's just basically, ult a person while your team does the real damage to kill them.

I played Malz non stop for a year, so probably had similar XP on him to Eon's friend - It really does feel like they've removed his power and ability to be a threat as a solo champion. I do see him played more now as a support which is disappointing - and I don't understand how that works effectively as his E needs to bounce off minion kills to keep his mana levels somewhat high..

Maybe im just bad, but i mentioned the same thing to a friend of mine the other day, as a guy who has like 30k champ exp on malzahar on another account, i can quite safely say that hes considerably weaker when it matters. Theyve given him 50% damage to neutral minions to prevent his early jungling, but that pretty much f***ks him as a jungler altogether, theyve made it so its hard to cycle voidlings, and made it nearly impossible to sustain damage in lane without some form of mana item

Theyve forced him into one role, and hes played more as a support champ now for a reason

His E refreshes on Q or R hit? Since damage from standard build is from rylai/liandry, he's still good. + his new passive that gets less cooldown at higher champ level means hes more safe. Less base damage is compensated by more safety, ROA is still core too. So with max cdr on this build, you are tanky and can still dish out massive DoT.
